glsa.title: OpenSSL: Denial of Service
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in OpenSSL might allow remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service condition.

background.p: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.

description.p: It was discovered that OpenSSL allow malicious servers to send very large primes to a client during DH(E) based TLS handshakes.

impact.p: A remote attacker, by sending large prime to client during DH(E) TLS handshake, could possibly cause a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
